docs.snippet: At the meeting of the Board of Aldermen, last evening, a petition from the Twelfth Regiment, N. Y.S.M., for reparation for losses to uniform, during their three months' service, was laid over and ordered printed in the minutes.

headline.main: CITY AND COUNTY AFFAIRS.; BOARD OF ALDERMEN. THE CORPORATION PRINTING--THE MAYOR'S MESSAGE--THE RULES OF THE BOARD--MR. BRADY'S OPINION OF THE LEGISLATURE.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the meeting of the Board of Aldermen, last evening, a petition from the Twelfth Regiment, N. Y.S.M., for reparation for losses to uniform, during their three months' service, was laid over and ordered printed in the minutes.

docs.snippet: Yesterday, the Twenty-eighth Massachusetts Regiment, Col. WILLIAM MONTEITH, arrived at Governor's Island from West Cambridge, where it has been encamped since the beginning of last October. The regiment members nearly a thousand mer, all of whom are...
docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday, the Twenty-eighth Massachusetts Regiment, Col. WILLIAM MONTEITH, arrived at Governor's Island from West Cambridge, where it has been encamped since the beginning of last October. The regiment members nearly a thousand mer, all of whom are Irish, from the Colonel downward. Enfield rifles the men are armed with.

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT HATTERAS INLET.; Bad Condition of the Men Waiting for the Rebels The Relief Sent to the Loyal North Carolinians, &c.

docs.abstract: Reports from Cairo, Port Royal and Hatteras Inlet
docs.lead_paragraph: Nothing but the most consummate skill and wisdom can keep the troops here from utter demoralization. This is true, especially in the case of the New-York Ninth. This body of men have had a hard campaign here during a very sickly Summer season, and now are kept here contrary to the advice and protest of their medical staff, who have urged their removal on purely sanitary grounds.

headline.main: THE BURNSIDE EXPEDITION.; Departure of the Great Fleet from Annapolis. A STIRRING SCENE ON THE CHESAPEAKE. The Trip Down the Bay, and Arrival at Fortress Monroe. Some Idea of the Personnel of the Expedition. STAFF OF THE COMMANDING GENERAL.

docs.lead_paragraph: When I announced the near sailing of the expedition, I saw every evidence that in a few moments the entire fleet would be in motion down the Chesapeake. Circumstances, however, delayed our departure until 3 o'clock P.M., at which time a sudden change in the weather, indicating the near approach of a storm, decided the commanding General to postpone the final departure until after midnight, or until morning. docs.lead_paragraph: ACADEMY OF MUSIC. ANNUAL MEETING OF THE STOCKHOLDERS. The annual meeting of the stockholders of the Academy of Music was held on Friday evening, when the following named persons were elected directors, in place of those whose terms had expired : L.B. Wyman, Henry E. Pierrepont, SamlSloan, Isaac H. Frothingham, Marcellus Massey. The Treasurer submitted the following statement for the year ending Jan. 10, 1862:
